ground_truth: Wilbur looks to Ruthie, and they're in complete agreement as they get the hell out of there. Zacky would run too, but Don holds him by the collar. Edward curves around the tall bushes that hide the front door and steps onto the porch. The boards squeal and creak, but he continues on. A cat screams out from a broken wicker rocker. Catching his breath, Edward reaches the front door. The doorknob is ancient brass with two projections that look like horns. Yet Edward extends his hand, reaching closer and closer before he finally, impossibly fast, the door opens, revealing an old woman with a patch over her left eye. She looks like she's been dead for years, but too stubborn to lie down. Zacky and Don Price wait for Edward, each moment more convinced he's already dead, but suddenly, he's back at the gate. The old woman steps out of the shadows behind Edward, flipping up her eye patch. When their flashlight beam hits her left eye, it shines with a hellish glow. We rush in on Zacky, who is paralyzed by what he sees. An old man -- Zacky -- stands on a wobbly stepladder, changing a lightbulb. Suddenly, the ladder gives way and he falls, dead. We rush in on Don Price as twenty-year-old Don Price falls face-forward on the tile, face mushed in the grout, very much dead. Don and Zacky both tremble with fear, the latter has tears in his eyes. The brothers suddenly bolt, still standing next to the old woman, Edward smiles. Edward helps her back inside. He could leave now, but curiosity gets the better of him. The old woman turns to him slightly, still not facing him. She smiles a little, a crooked grin of broken teeth, then turns leaning her face right in front of his. On a silent count of one, two, three, Edward looks into the eye. This time we don't cut, instead we hold on Edward as he witnesses his death. He stares transfixed, perplexed and amused. The old woman nods, heading back to the house. Dr. Julius Bennett (85) enters from the foyer, still winded from coming down the stairs. He judges her belly and leans close to her, whispering in her ear. She smiles, surprised but not doubting. Coming out from the kitchen, Will slowly climbs the stairs. They creak with every step. The wall is filled with family photos of happier times, mostly pictures of Will starting when he was an infant and ending at his wedding. As he climbs the stairs, we can see him growing up with every step. A crack of sunlight spills around the half-open door at the end of the hallway.

Edward bends around the high shrubs that obscure the front entry and steps onto the veranda. The planks squeal and groan, but he persists on. A feline shrieks out from a shattered wicker rocker. She appears like she's been deceased for years, but too obstinate to lie down. Zacky and Don Price await Edward, each instant more convinced he's already deceased, but unexpectedly, he's back at the gate. The elderly woman steps out of the shadows behind Edward, flipping up her eye patch. When their flashlight beam hits her left eye, it gleams with an infernal glow. We rush in on Don Price as twenty-year-old Don Price falls face-forward on the tile, face mushed in the grout, very much deceased. Don and Zacky both shiver with terror, the latter has tears in his eyes. The siblings suddenly bolt, still standing next to the elderly woman, Edward grins. Edward assists her back inside. He could depart now, but inquisitiveness gets the better of him. The elderly woman turns to him slightly, still not facing him. She grins a little, a crooked smile of fractured teeth, then turns leaning her face right in front of his. On a silent count of one, two, three, Edward gazes into the eye. This time we don't cut, instead we hold on Edward as he witnesses his demise. He stares transfixed, bewildered and entertained. The elderly woman nods, heading back to the residence. Dr. Julius Bennett (85) enters from the foyer, still winded from descending the stairs. He assesses her abdomen and leans close to her, murmuring in her ear. She grins, astonished but not doubting. Coming out from the kitchen, Will slowly ascends the stairs. They groan with every step. The wall is filled with kin photos of happier periods, mostly pictures of Will beginning when he was an infant and concluding at his nuptials. As he ascends the stairs, we can see him maturing with every step. A fissure of sunlight spills around the half-open entry at the end of the corridor.

The tall bushes that hide the front door are curved around by Edward, and he steps onto the porch. The boards are squealed and creaked by them, but on he continues. The shadows behind Edward are stepped out of by the old woman, and her eye patch is flipped up by her. When her left eye is hit by their flashlight beam, it shines with a hellish glow. Don Price is rushed in on by us as twenty-year-old Don Price falls face-forward on the tile, his face mushed in the grout, very much dead. Fear causes both Don and Zacky to tremble, tears fill the latter's eyes. The brothers bolt suddenly, while Edward, still standing next to the old woman, smiles. The old woman is helped back inside by Edward. Leaving now could be done by him, but his curiosity gets the better of him. The old woman turns slightly to him, still not facing him. A little smile, a crooked grin of broken teeth, is given by her, then turning and leaning her face right in front of his. On a silent count of one, two, three, the eye is looked into by Edward. This time we don't cut, instead, Edward is held on by us as his death is witnessed by him. Perplexity and amusement fill him as he stares transfixed. A nod is given by the old woman, and her house is headed back to by her. Dr. Julius Bennett (85) enters from the foyer, still winded from coming down the stairs. Her belly is judged by him, and a whisper is leaned close to her ear by him. A smile, surprised but not doubting, is shown by her. Will slowly climbs the stairs coming out from the kitchen. Every step is creaked with by them. Family photos of happier times fill the wall, mostly pictures of Will starting when he was an infant and ending at his wedding. As the stairs are climbed by him, his growing up is seen with every step. A crack of sunlight is spilled around the half-open door at the end of the hallway.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Wilbur looks at Ruthie, and they agree to leave immediately. Zacky wants to run, but Don holds him by the collar. Edward rounds the bushes concealing the entrance and steps onto the creaky porch. A cat screeches from a broken rocker. Catching his breath, Edward reaches the door. Its ancient brass knob with horn-like projections doesn't deter him. He reaches out, and the door opens, revealing an old woman with an eye patch. She appears long dead, yet defiant. Zacky and Don Price anxiously wait, fearing Edward's demise until he suddenly returns to the gate. The old woman emerges, revealing a hellish glow from her uncovered eye. Zacky, paralyzed by the sight, envisions himself, aged, falling from a ladder, dead. Don Price sees his own death too, collapsed face-first on the tile. The brothers, terrified, flee. Edward, smiling, helps the old woman back inside, curiosity overtaking him. She turns slightly, her crooked grin displayed, then leans toward Edward. On a silent count, he looks into her eye, witnessing his death in awe and amusement. The old woman nods and heads inside. Dr. Julius Bennett, 85, appears, winded from descending the stairs, and whispers to her, making her smile. Will emerges from the kitchen, climbing the creaky stairs lined with family photos, depicting his growth from infancy to marriage. Sunlight spills through a half-open door at the hallway's end.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Wilbur and Ruthie agree and quickly leave, while Don holds Zacky. Edward curves around tall bushes, stepping onto a creaky porch where a cat screams. He reaches an ancient brass doorknob, extending his hand. Suddenly, the door opens, revealing an old, eyepatched woman. Zacky and Don Price watch, convinced Edward's already dead until he's back at the gate. The woman flips her eye patch, her left eye glowing hellishly. Zacky is paralyzed, seeing his own death as an old man on a stepladder. Don Price envisions his younger self dead on a tile floor. Fearful, the brothers bolt, but Edward smiles with the old woman. Curiosity keeps him there as she smiles at him, prompting him to look into her eye, witnessing his own death, perplexed but amused. She nods and leaves. Dr. Julius Bennett enters from the foyer, whispers to her, and she smiles. Will ascends creaky stairs filled with family photos, showing his life from infancy to marriage. Sunlight spills through a half-open door at the hallway's end.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Wilbur casts a glance towards Ruthie, and in that shared moment, they find themselves in perfect agreement. Together, without hesitation, they decide to hightail it out of there. Zacky, too, would likely follow suit and make a run for it, but Don's firm grip on his collar keeps him in place. Meanwhile, Edward takes a cautious yet determined path, curving gracefully around the tall, imposing bushes that expertly conceal the front door from view, and steps confidently onto the creaky old porch. As he treads, the wooden boards beneath him emit a series of squeals and creaks, yet undeterred, he presses onward. Suddenly, a cat yowls, its cry piercing the air from its resting place on a broken, timeworn wicker rocker. As Edward steadies his breath, he finally reaches the ominous front door. The doorknob, fashioned from ancient brass, intriguingly features two distinct projections resembling horns. Nevertheless, Edward boldly extends his hand and reaches ever closer until, in a flash, impossibly fast, the door swings open. Standing there is an old woman, her left eye obscured by a patch. Her appearance suggests she has been dead for countless years, yet through sheer stubborn will, she refuses to lie down. 

Zacky and Don Price anxiously wait for Edward, their anxiety growing with each passing moment, each more convinced of his demise. Suddenly, Edward reappears at the gate, seemingly unscathed. The old woman, stepping from the shadows behind Edward, flips up her eye patch. When the beam of their flashlight hits her exposed left eye, it blazes with an unnatural, hellish glow. We zoom in on Zacky, who stands motionless, frozen by the terrifying sight. An old man—Zacky himself—is precariously positioned on a wobbly stepladder, attempting to change a lightbulb. In an instant, the ladder gives way, and he plummets to the ground, lifeless. The focus then shifts to Don Price as a young Don Price of twenty years falls forward onto the cold tile floor, his face embedded in the grout and unmistakably dead. Both Don and Zacky tremble with overwhelming fear, tears welling up in Zacky's eyes. With sudden urgency, the brothers bolt away. Meanwhile, remaining beside the old woman, Edward allows a smile to cross his face. He assists her back inside the house, aware he could easily leave now, yet driven by curiosity, he lingers. The old woman tilts her head slightly towards him, still not fully turning. She gives a slight smile, a crooked grin revealing broken teeth, before leaning in close to Edward's face. On a silent count of one, two, three, Edward gazes into her eye. This time there is no cut, no break; instead, we linger on Edward as he stands in rapt attention, witnessing a vision of his own demise. His gaze is a mix of transfixed fascination, perplexity, and subtle amusement. The old woman nods knowingly and slowly retreats into the dwelling. Dr. Julius Bennett, aged 85, enters from the foyer, still slightly breathless from his descent down the stairs. He observes her belly with a discerning eye and leans close, whispering quietly into her ear. Her eyes light up with surprise, though devoid of any doubt. Emerging from the kitchen, Will begins his slow ascent up the stairs. Each step is marked by a creak, echoing the weight of history. The walls are adorned with family photos that capture moments of joy from the past, predominantly pictures chronicling Will's journey from infancy to his wedding day. As he climbs each step, we witness his growth, a visual timeline of his life. Finally, a crack of sunlight spills into the hallway from the doorway at its end, partially open.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Wilbur turns his head and casts a meaningful glance towards Ruthie, and in that shared, fleeting moment of understanding, they both find themselves in an unspoken yet perfectly harmonious agreement. Together, and without a moment's hesitation or second thought, they decide that their best course of action is to make a hasty exit from the scene. Zacky, too, would most likely find himself compelled to follow their lead and dash away, but Don's firm and resolute grip on his collar prevents any such movement, keeping him firmly anchored in place. Meanwhile, Edward opts for a cautious, yet determined route, skillfully maneuvering in a sweeping, graceful curve around the tall, imposing bushes that serve as an expert concealment for the front door, hidden from direct view. He steps with confidence onto the creaky, weathered porch. As he walks, the wooden boards beneath his feet emit a series of persistent squeals and creaks, creating an audible protest, yet Edward remains undeterred and presses onward with resolve. Suddenly, the sharp, piercing cry of a cat yowling splits the air, emanating from its resting place on a broken, timeworn wicker rocking chair. As Edward steadies his breathing, he finally arrives at the ominous front door. The doorknob, made from ancient, well-worn brass, intriguingly features two distinct projections that bear a striking resemblance to horns. Nevertheless, Edward, with a bold heart, extends his hand and reaches confidently closer, until, in a flash, as if moved by an unseen force, the door swings open with impossible speed. Standing before him is an old woman, her left eye obscured by a patch, giving an eerie appearance. Her overall appearance suggests she has long since departed from this world, many years past, yet, through sheer, stubborn determination and will, she refuses to surrender to the ground. 

Zacky and Don Price, both filled with growing anxiety and trepidation, anxiously wait for Edward's return, their worry intensifying with each passing moment, each becoming more convinced of his unfortunate demise. Suddenly, to their immense relief, Edward reappears at the gate, miraculously unscathed. The old woman, stepping out from the shadows behind Edward, flips up her eye patch. When the beam of their flashlight lands upon her previously covered left eye, it blazes with an unnatural, otherworldly glow, casting a hellish light. We zoom in on Zacky, who stands utterly motionless, frozen by the terrifying sight before him. An old man—Zacky himself in his later years—is precariously balanced atop a wobbly stepladder, attempting to change a lightbulb. In an instant, the ladder gives way beneath him, and he plummets to the ground, meeting his end. The focus then shifts to Don Price as a young Don Price, at the tender age of twenty years, suddenly falls forward onto the cold, unforgiving tile floor, his face settling into the grout, unmistakably lifeless. Both Don and Zacky are overwhelmed with paralyzing fear, tears starting to well up in Zacky's eyes. With sudden urgency and a burst of adrenaline, the brothers take off, fleeing in haste. Meanwhile, standing beside the enigmatic old woman, Edward allows a smile to play upon his lips. Despite having the opportunity to leave, he chooses to assist her back inside the house, driven by an insatiable curiosity, he lingers in her presence. The old woman, with an almost imperceptible tilt of her head towards him, still not fully turning, gives a slight smile, a crooked grin revealing broken teeth, before leaning in close to Edward's face. On a silent count of one, two, three, Edward gazes deeply into her eye. This time, there is no cut to another scene, no narrative break; instead, we linger on Edward, who stands in complete rapt attention, witnessing a vision of his own demise. His gaze is a complex mix of transfixed fascination, perplexity, and a subtle touch of amusement. The old woman nods with a knowing expression and slowly retreats into the dwelling. Dr. Julius Bennett, aged 85, enters from the foyer, still slightly breathless from his descent down the staircase. He observes her with a discerning eye, leaning in close to whisper quietly into her ear. Her eyes light up with a spark of surprise, though they remain devoid of any hint of doubt. Emerging from the kitchen, Will begins his slow, deliberate ascent up the stairs. Each step he takes is marked by a creak, echoing the weight and history of the house. The walls are adorned with family photographs that capture moments of joy from the past, predominantly featuring pictures chronicling Will's journey from infancy to the significant milestone of his wedding day. As he climbs each step, we witness his growth, a visual timeline intricately detailing the story of his life. Finally, a crack of sunlight spills into the hallway from the doorway at its far end, partially open, hinting at the world beyond.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Wilbur casts a knowing glance at Ruthie, and they both share an unspoken understanding, quickly deciding to leave the area as fast as possible. Meanwhile, Zacky prepares to take off too, but his movement is abruptly halted as Don firmly grips his collar, preventing his escape. Edward skillfully navigates around the tall, concealing bushes that obscure the front door from view and confidently steps onto the porch. As he progresses forward, the wooden boards beneath his feet emit a symphony of squeals and creaks, but he persists without hesitation. Suddenly, a cat emits a loud screech from its perch on a broken wicker rocker, momentarily startling Edward, who pauses to catch his breath before reaching the front door. He observes the doorknob made of ancient brass, noticing its two horn-like projections, and despite the eerie appearance, he extends his hand towards it, inching closer and closer until, in a flash of impossibly swift motion, the door swings open. Standing before him is an old woman with a patch over her left eye, her appearance suggesting she has resisted death for years through sheer stubbornness. Meanwhile, Zacky and Don Price wait anxiously for Edward, increasingly convinced with each passing moment that he might already be dead, but abruptly, he reappears at the gate. The old woman steps out from the shadows behind Edward, dramatically flipping up her eye patch as their flashlight beam strikes her left eye, which glows with an ominous, hellish light. We focus intensely on Zacky's face, frozen in fear at the sight before him. An older man, also named Zacky, is precariously balanced on a wobbly stepladder, in the midst of changing a lightbulb. Without warning, the ladder collapses, and he falls, resulting in his death. We shift our attention to Don Price, just as a twenty-year-old version of him falls face-first onto the tile, his face pressed into the grout, unmistakably deceased. Both Don and Zacky are overwhelmed with fear, with Zacky visibly trembling, tears brimming in his eyes. In a sudden burst of adrenaline, the brothers take off running, leaving Edward standing beside the old woman with a curious smile on his face. Despite having the option to leave, Edward's curiosity wins out, and he assists the old woman back inside. She turns slightly towards him, though still not directly facing him, and offers a small, crooked grin, revealing her broken teeth. She then leans her face closer to his, and as Edward silently counts to three, he gazes into her eye. This time, we remain focused on Edward as he experiences a vision of his own death, remaining transfixed, both perplexed and amused. The old woman nods knowingly and returns to the house. Dr. Julius Bennett, aged eighty-five, emerges from the foyer, still catching his breath after descending the stairs. He assesses her condition with a discerning eye and leans in to whisper something in her ear, eliciting a surprised but unquestioning smile from her. As she re-enters the house, Will emerges from the kitchen and begins to slowly ascend the stairs, each step producing a creaking sound. As he climbs, the walls reveal an array of family photos capturing moments of joy from the past, primarily depicting Will from his infancy through his wedding day. With every step upward, we witness Will's journey of growing up, framed by a narrow beam of sunlight spilling through the partially open door at the end of the hallway.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Wilbur and Ruthie quickly decide to leave, while Don holds Zacky back by his collar to prevent him from fleeing as well. Edward navigates around the tall bushes, steps onto the creaky porch, and reaches the front door, where he encounters an old woman with a patch over her left eye. As he approaches, the door suddenly opens, and she appears as though defying death itself. Zacky and Don, expecting the worst for Edward, remain outside, growing increasingly anxious, until Edward abruptly reappears at the gate. The old woman follows, revealing her eye, which reflects a sinister glow in the flashlight beam and paralyzes Zacky with fear. A vision unfolds where an older Zacky falls to his death from a stepladder, followed by a similar fate for a younger Don Price. Overwhelmed, Zacky and Don flee, while Edward, intrigued, assists the old woman back inside. Her mysterious demeanor captivates him, prompting him to gaze into her eye. As he does, Edward experiences a vision of his own death, leaving him both puzzled and amused. Dr. Julius Bennett arrives from the foyer, exchanges a brief, intimate word with the old woman, and she responds with a knowing smile. Meanwhile, Will ascends the staircase, each creaking step accompanied by family photos chronicling his life, culminating at a slightly ajar door illuminated by sunlight.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Wilbur looks to Ruthie, both of them knowing the danger of the place they stumbled upon, and they're in complete agreement as they get the hell out of there. Zacky would run too, but Don holds him by the collar, their bond as brothers unbroken even in fear. Edward curves around the tall bushes that hide the front door, remnants from an old garden planted by the previous owners, and steps onto the porch. The boards, weathered by decades of harsh winters, squeal and creak, but he continues on undeterred by the decay. A cat, perhaps a descendant of the many strays that roamed this neighborhood, screams out from a broken wicker rocker that long ago adorned someone’s sunlit porch. Catching his breath, Edward reaches the front door. The doorknob, an ancient brass relic from the late 1800s with two projections that look like horns, seems to call to him. Yet Edward extends his hand, a sense of foreboding mixed with curiosity, reaching closer and closer before he finally, impossibly fast, the door opens, revealing an old woman with a patch over her left eye. She looks like she's been dead for years, but too stubborn to lie down, a testament to the house's ghostly reputation. Zacky and Don Price wait for Edward, each moment more convinced he's already dead, legends of the house's macabre history playing in their minds, but suddenly, he's back at the gate. The old woman steps out of the shadows behind Edward, flipping up her eye patch. When their flashlight beam hits her left eye, it shines with a hellish glow, a trick said to be the curse of a long-forgotten spell. We rush in on Zacky, who is paralyzed by what he sees. An old man -- Zacky -- stands on a wobbly stepladder, changing a lightbulb in a dimly lit kitchen. Suddenly, the ladder gives way and he falls, dead, fulfilling a fate he’d always feared. We rush in on Don Price as twenty-year-old Don Price falls face-forward on the tile, face mushed in the grout, very much dead, the consequence of a reckless youth. Don and Zacky both tremble with fear, the latter has tears in his eyes as the weight of their visions bed down in their minds. The brothers suddenly bolt, still standing next to the old woman, Edward smiles, strangely at home in her macabre domain. Edward helps her back inside, feeling an unexplainable kinship. He could leave now, but curiosity gets the better of him, an insatiable desire to understand the otherworldly connection they share. The old woman turns to him slightly, still not facing him. She smiles a little, a crooked grin of broken teeth filled with stories of the past, then turns leaning her face right in front of his. On a silent count of one, two, three, Edward looks into the eye. This time we don't cut, instead we hold on Edward as he witnesses his death, foreseen in the glow of her enchanted eye. He stares transfixed, perplexed and amused by the inevitability of it all. The old woman nods, heading back to the house, content with the passing of another soul through her haunted care. Dr. Julius Bennett, the town’s oldest living resident at 85, enters from the foyer, still winded from coming down the stairs that have been in his family for generations. He judges her belly—a traditional gesture of the region meant to predict fortune—and leans close to her, whispering in her ear. She smiles, surprised but not doubting, the comfort of old friendships evident. Coming out from the kitchen, Will slowly climbs the stairs, aware they creak with every step like the echoes of history. The wall is filled with family photos of happier times, mostly pictures of Will starting when he was an infant and ending at his wedding, a testament to a family lineage tied to this house for nearly a century. As he climbs the stairs, we can see him growing up with every step, each photo capturing another chapter of life. A crack of sunlight spills around the half-open door at the end of the hallway, hinting at new beginnings in a house filled with the weight of its history.

test_cases.description: Wilbur looks to Ruthie and they are in complete agreement as they get the hell out of there. Zacky would run too but Don holds him by the collar. Edward curves around the tall bushes that hide the front door and steps onto the porch. The boards squeal and creak but he continues on. A cat screams out from a broken wicker rocker. Catching his breath. Edward reaches the front door. The doorknob is ancient brass with two projections that look like horns. Yet Edward extends his hand reaching closer and closer before he finally impossibly fast the door opens revealing an old woman with a patch over her left eye. She looks like she is been dead for years but too stubborn to lie down. Zacky and Don Price wait for Edward each moment more convinced he is already dead but suddenly he is back at the gate. The old woman steps out of the shadows behind Edward flipping up her eye patch. When their flashlight beam hits her left eye it shines with a hellish glow. We rush in on Zacky who is paralyzed by what he sees. An old man. Zacky  stands on a wobbly stepladder changing a lightbulb. Suddenly the ladder gives way and he falls dead. We rush in on Don Price as twentyyearold. Don Price falls faceforward on the tile face mushed in the grout very much dead. Don and Zacky both tremble with fear. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. the latter has tears in his eyes. The brothers suddenly bolt still standing next to the old woman. Edward smiles. Edward helps her back inside. He could leave now but curiosity gets the better of him. The old woman turns to him slightly still not facing him. She smiles a little a crooked grin of broken teeth then turns leaning her face right in front of his. On a silent count of one two three. Edward looks into the eye. This time we do not cut. instead we hold on Edward as he witnesses his death. He stares transfixed perplexed and amused. The old woman nods heading back to the house. Dr Julius Bennett 85 enters from the foyer still winded from coming down the stairs. He judges her belly and leans close to her whispering in her ear. She smiles surprised but not doubting. Coming out from the kitchen Will slowly climbs the stairs. They creak with every step. The wall is filled with family photos of happier times mostly pictures of Will starting when he was an infant and ending at his wedding. As he climbs the stairs we can see him growing up with every step. A crack of sunlight spills around the halfopen door at the end of the hallway.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Harold glances at Mabel, and they're in complete confusion as they fling themselves away from there. Benny would leap as well, but Tim grips him by the hat. Gerald zigzags around the short hedges that reveal the back gate and hops onto the deck. The beams groan and shift, but he presses on. A dog howls out from a shattered wicker basket. Gasping, Gerald arrives at the back gate. The handle is rusty copper with three attachments that resemble antlers. However, Gerald stretches his arm, inching closer and closer before he finally, unbelievably swift, the gate swings open, unveiling a young man with a patch over his right eye. He appears like he's been lost for decades, but too brave to fade away. Benny and Tim Harris wait for Gerald, each second more assured he's already vanished, but unexpectedly, he's back at the hedge. The young man leaps out of the mist behind Gerald, flipping down his handkerchief. When their candlelight illuminates his right eye, it glows with a devilish gleam. We close in on Benny, who is frozen by the spectacle. A young woman -- Benny -- stands on a shaky footstool, painting a mural. Unexpectedly, the stool collapses and she tumbles, breathless. We close in on Tim Harris as sixty-year-old Tim Harris slips backward on the carpet, head crumpled in the fabric, very much breathless. Tim and Benny both shiver with fright, the former has laughter in his eyes. The sisters suddenly sprint, still standing next to the young man, Gerald grins. Gerald aids him back outside. He could escape now, but intrigue wins over him. The young man turns to him slightly, still not acknowledging him. He smirks a bit, a skewed grin of jagged teeth, then swivels leaning his cheek right beside his. On a muffled note of one, two, three, Gerald gazes into the eye. This instant we don't shift, instead we focus on Gerald as he encounters his fate. He gawks transfixed, bewildered and entertained. The young man nods, retreating back to the yard. Professor Douglas Turner (64) enters from the basement, still flustered from ascending the ladder. He assesses her hand and leans close to her, murmuring in her hair. She laughs, startled but not questioning. Arriving from the office, Sam quickly crosses the fence. They moan with every motion. The ceiling is covered with pet portraits of older days, mainly sketches of Sam starting when she was a teenager and ending at her graduation. As she crosses the fence, we can see her aging with each motion. A beam of moonlight slips around the partly closed window at the corner of the garden.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Wilbur and Ruthie quickly decide to leave, while Don holds Zacky back. Edward approaches a creaky porch, reaching for the ancient brass doorknob, and encounters an old woman with a patch over her eye. Despite her ghostly appearance, she opens the door swiftly. Zacky and Don watch anxiously as Edward returns to the gate. The old woman reveals a glowing eye beneath her patch, causing Zacky to freeze in terror as he envisions his own death from a fall. Similarly, Don imagines his demise on a tiled floor. Terrified, the brothers flee. Edward remains intrigued, stays with the woman, and dares to look into her eye, witnessing his death. An old Dr. Julius Bennett whispers something to her that makes her smile. Meanwhile, Will ascends creaking stairs lined with family photos of his life, leading to a sunlit door at the hallway's end.
